greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest number x such that x and x+1 are prime(n)-smooth but not prime(n-1)-smooth.
comment: Note that this sequence is not always increasing. For many n, a(n) is the same as A002072(n). See A145605 for a triangle of values.
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Oct 14 2008
ext: Terms a(16) onward by _Andrey V. Kulsha_, Aug 10 2011, according to Jim White's computations
